revised_title: Authigenic Silicate Minerals and the Magnesium Budget in the Oceans
tldr: This article discusses the processes of authigenic silicate minerals removing magnesium from seawater. It examines magnesium removal during anoxic diagenesis and in the basalt-seawater system, providing thermodynamic predictions for these processes. The study highlights the importance of understanding the magnesium budget in the oceans for steady-state models of ocean geochemistry.
